{#d9fa9d82 .cell execution_count=12} ``` {.python .cell-code} list_of_months = ["Jun", "Jul", "Aug"] df[list_of_months].stack().head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=12} ``` Year 1880 Jun -0.18 Jul -0.22 Aug -0.25 1881 Jun -0.34 Jul 0.09 dtype: float64 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#dc48fc21 .cell execution_count=13} ``` {.python .cell-code} fig, axes = plt.subplots(ncols=3, figsize=(9, 4), sharex=True, sharey=True) for ax, period in zip(axes, df["Period"].dropna().unique()): df.loc[df["Period"] == period, list_of_months].stack().hist(ax=ax) ax.set_title(period) plt.suptitle("Histogram of temperature anomalies") axes[1].set_xlabel("Summer temperature distribution") plt.tight_layout() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display} ![](index_files/figure-html/cell-14-output-1.png){width=2631 height=1190} ::: ::: ::: {#e41eb7a5 .cell execution_count=14} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Create a variable that has years 1951 to 1980, and months Jan to Dec (inclusive) temp_all_months = df.loc[(df.index >= 1951) & (df.index <= 1980), "Jan":"Dec"] # Put all the data in stacked format and give the new columns sensible names temp_all_months = ( temp_all_months.stack() .reset_index() .rename(columns={"level_1": "month", 0: "values"}) ) # Take a look at this data: temp_all_months ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=14} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#dc35f03e .cell execution_count=15} ``` {.python .cell-code} quantiles = [0.3, 0.7] list_of_percentiles = np.quantile(temp_all_months["values"], q=quantiles) print(f"The cold threshold of {quantiles[0]*100}% is {list_of_percentiles[0]}") print(f"The hot threshold of {quantiles[1]*100}% is {list_of_percentiles[1]}") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` The cold threshold of 30.0% is -0.1 The hot threshold of 70.0% is 0.1 ``` ::: ::: ::: {#182e97ca .cell execution_count=16} ``` {.python .cell-code} # Create a variable that has years 1981 to 2010, and months Jan to Dec (inclusive) temp_all_months = df.loc[(df.index >= 1981) & (df.index <= 2010), "Jan":"Dec"] # Put all the data in stacked format and give the new columns sensible names temp_all_months = ( temp_all_months.stack() .reset_index() .rename(columns={"level_1": "month", 0: "values"}) ) # Take a look at the start of this data data: temp_all_months.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=16} ```{=html}
Year month values
0 1981 Jan 0.80
1 1981 Feb 0.62
2 1981 Mar 0.68
3 1981 Apr 0.39
4 1981 May 0.18
``` ::: ::: ::: {#fef25b37 .cell execution_count=17} ``` {.python .cell-code} entries_less_than_q30 = temp_all_months["values"] < list_of_percentiles[0] proportion_under_q30 = entries_less_than_q30.mean() print( f"The proportion under {list_of_percentiles[0]} is {proportion_under_q30*100:.2f}%" ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` The proportion under -0.1 is 1.94% ``` ::: ::: ::: {#970afa41 .cell execution_count=18} ``` {.python .cell-code} proportion_over_q70 = (temp_all_months["values"] > list_of_percentiles[1]).mean() print(f"The proportion over {list_of_percentiles[1]} is {proportion_over_q70*100:.2f}%") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-stdout} ``` The proportion over 0.1 is 84.72% ``` ::: ::: ::: {#ed1e4cd1 .cell execution_count=19} ``` {.python .cell-code} temp_all_months = ( df.loc[:, "DJF":"SON"] .stack() .reset_index() .rename(columns={"level_1": "Season", 0: "Values"}) ) temp_all_months["Period"] = pd.cut( temp_all_months["Year"], bins=[1921, 1950, 1980, 2010], labels=["1921—1950", "1951—1980", "1981—2010"], ordered=True, ) # Take a look at a cut of the data using `.iloc`, which provides position temp_all_months.iloc[-135:-125] ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=19} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#2e50d103 .cell execution_count=21} ``` {.python .cell-code} min_year = 1880 ( ggplot(temp_all_months, aes(x="Year", y="Values", color="Season")) + geom_abline(slope=0, color="black", size=1) + geom_line(size=1) + labs( title=f"Average annual temperature anomaly in \n in the northern hemisphere ({min_year}—{temp_all_months['Year'].max()})", y="Annual temperature anomalies", ) + scale_x_continuous(format="d") + geom_text( x=min_year, y=0.1, label="1951—1980 average", hjust="left", color="black" ) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=21} ```{=html} ``` ::: ::: ::: {#6c346e8f .cell execution_count=22} ``` {.python .cell-code} df_co2 = pd.read_csv("./file/data2.csv") df_co2.head() ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=22} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#14986851 .cell execution_count=25} ``` {.python .cell-code} ( ggplot(df_temp_co2, aes(x="Jun", y="Trend")) + geom_point(color="black", size=3) + labs( title="Scatterplot of temperature anomalies vs carbon dioxide emissions", y="Carbon dioxide levels (trend, mole fraction)", x="Temperature anomaly (degrees Celsius)", ) ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=25} ```{=html} ``` ::: ::: ::: {#2d0c6031 .cell execution_count=26} ``` {.python .cell-code} df_temp_co2[["Jun", "Trend"]].corr(method="pearson") ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=26} ```{=html}

``` ::: ::: ::: {#d5b691b7 .cell execution_count=27} ``` {.python .cell-code} ( ggplot(df_temp_co2, aes(x="Year", y="Jun")) + geom_line(size=1) + labs( title="June temperature anomalies", ) + scale_x_continuous(format="d") ) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=27} ```{=html} ``` ::: ::: ::: {#20ed634d .cell execution_count=28} ``` {.python .cell-code} base_plot = ggplot(df_temp_co2) + scale_x_continuous(format="d") plot_p = ( base_plot + geom_line(aes(x="Year", y="Jun"), size=1) + labs(title="June temperature anomalies") ) plot_q = ( base_plot + geom_line(aes(x="Year", y="Trend"), size=1) + labs(title="Carbon dioxide emissions") ) gggrid([plot_p, plot_q], ncol=2) ``` ::: {.cell-output .cell-output-display execution_count=28} ```{=html} ``` ::: :::
